Name: ポート・スタントン@{I}$Port Stanton -> ポート・スタントン$Port Stanton
Description: Soul-hungry monkeys reluctantly tend this trading post, waiting for an opportunity to escape. Bloated fleas hop from ape to man and man to ape, gorging themselves without a care for which is which.

DefaultEvent.Name: $Wildweald Court -> ワイルドウィールド・コート$Letters from the Wildweald Court
DefaultEvent.Description: $Fallen London -> フォールン・ロンドン$You write down your latest discoveries and seal them, ready for delivery on return to Fallen London.

ChildBranches.Name: $Port Report -> 港湾報告書$Compile a Port Report
ChildBranches.Description: $Admiralty -> 海軍省$Now that the Admiralty has been brought up to date, this will be far quicker. Unfortunately, also less profitable.

DefaultEvent.Name: The islands of the Empire
DefaultEvent.Description: All of them warrant further attention. For now though, it would be best to see if your initial discoveries can whet the interest of anyone back home.

ChildBranches.Name: $Port Report -> 港湾報告書$Prepare a Comprehensive Port Report
ChildBranches.Description: $Admiralty -> 海軍省$Few have reason to brave the waters this far East, especially with the trade embargo. The Admiralty will pay especially well for up-to-date intelligence.

DefaultEvent.Name: The locals call this Shell Beach
DefaultEvent.Description:
$Empire of Hands -> エンパイア・オブ・ハンズ$It is a place of death, where the bones and still-rotting carcasses of man and ape alike are left to the thirst of the zee. The charnel history of the Empire of Hands stretches out amongst the flies and the maggots; of the apes who would be men and their stolen civilisation.

Something glints. Around the neck of a skeleton, a locket. You pocket it, though it does not look like it is worth much. The zee infamously takes much. Sometimes though, it gives back. Perhaps this will prove to be such a time for some hopeful soul out there.

ChildBranches.Name: Shore leave
ChildBranches.Description: The parasynthetic jungle holds many dangers. Step carefully. There is no authority beyond the fence.

DefaultEvent.Name: A chance for profit
DefaultEvent.Description: The second-hand worldliness in the Calculating Mayor's four-souled eyes glints as he sees you enter.

ChildBranches.Name: An Audience with the Calculating Mayor
ChildBranches.Description: He may keep you waiting, but he will find time in his busy schedule if there is a chance of profiting from it.

DefaultEvent.Name: Turned away
DefaultEvent.Description: Two monkey guards wielding rifles and rusty bayonets block the bridge. This is not for your eyes, outsider. Avert them. Walk away. Walk faster. Good human.

ChildBranches.Name: $Zeppelin -> ツェッペリン$The Zeppelin
ChildBranches.Description: Intense work is underway across the bridge.

DefaultEvent.Name: An eager departure
DefaultEvent.Description:
$[Bb]lemmigan -> ブレミガン$The blemmigan disappears into the dense jungle. It should thrive in the Empire's cold
humidity.

ChildBranches.Name: $[Bb]lemmigan -> ブレミガン$Put a blemmigan ashore
ChildBranches.Description: $[Bb]lemmigan -> ブレミガン$Blemmigans and monkeys on the same island? Nothing bad can come of this.

DefaultEvent.Name: A painstaking hunt
DefaultEvent.Description: $Pentecost -> ペンテコステ$Pentecost apes steal souls, but also traits and mannerisms from their victims. You just need to find the one that looks the most familiar.

ChildBranches.Name: Recover your soul
ChildBranches.Description: Some d__ned monkey took it? Even a devil would have the manners to ask! Well, they will not keep it for long!

DefaultEvent.Name: King of an empty castle
DefaultEvent.Description: The Flea-Ridden Mayor scratches himself on a chair made of crates, surrounded by boxes of long-rotten trade goods. As a five-souled ape, he would be able to petition for membership of Court. For now, the trade embargo has left him trapped on the outside; a three-souled overseer with no talent for order.

ChildBranches.Name: An Audience with the Flea-Ridden Mayor
ChildBranches.Description: He is not busy. No appointments are required.

DefaultEvent.Name: $Port Stanton -> ポート・スタントン$The king of Port Stanton
DefaultEvent.Description: "Ah, my dearest human..." trills the Esteemed Mayor, relaxing as a concubine picks the nits from his hair. She presents the latest to him, but he graciously gives her permission to eat it herself. Such is the generosity of a five-souled monkey.

ChildBranches.Name: An Audience with the Esteemed Mayor
ChildBranches.Description: $Wildweald Court -> ワイルドウィールド・コート$He leaves you waiting for several minutes. As the newest member of the Wildweald Court, it would not do to be seen getting friendly with outsiders.

DefaultEvent.Name: A polite welcome
DefaultEvent.Description: $Delightful Adventuress -> 愉快な女冒険家$"Darling, do come in," the Civilised Mayor purrs. "Whatever can I do for you?" The soul of the Delightful Adventuress sits comfortably in him, a four-souled ape of cold ambition and very few scruples.

ChildBranches.Name: An Audience with the Civilised Mayor
ChildBranches.Description: Talk business? Why, yes, yes, of course we shall. But after a cup of tea. One must do these things correctly.

DefaultEvent.Name: The guards allow you through
DefaultEvent.Description: $Zeppelin -> ツェッペリン$Many monkeys are working on the Zeppelin. Many more are feverishly pretending to, banging nails into blocks of wood or smoothing out smooth cloth in an attempt to convince their overseers that they're helping.

ChildBranches.Name: $Zeppelin -> ツェッペリン$The Zeppelin
ChildBranches.Description: You now have permission to visit and bring supplies.

DefaultEvent.Name: The most precious thing in the Empire
DefaultEvent.Description: $Zeppelin -> ツェッペリン$The Emperor is not a trusting ape. His guards are stationed all around the Zeppelin. None will get close without his explicit permission.

ChildBranches.Name: $Zeppelin -> ツェッペリン$The Zeppelin
ChildBranches.Description: $Pentecost -> ペンテコステ$The great work of the Pentecost apes is complete. Soon, they will escape their quarantine.

DefaultEvent.Name: The end of a dream
DefaultEvent.Description: $Glory -> グローリー$The Penties put everything they had into this. What remains of the Soaring Glory will soon be little but a memorial to the apes that would be men.

ChildBranches.Name: $Zeppelin -> ツェッペリン$The Zeppelin
ChildBranches.Description: Pieces of cloth and ash still regularly blow into port.

DefaultEvent.Name: A return to Shell Beach
DefaultEvent.Description:
The bones and rotting carcasses stretch out in all their macabre glory. Deep strata of maggots squish and crunch underfoot as you search for treasures amongst the dead.

Aha! Here is a trinket that any other searchers have missed. You rub it clean and slip it into a pocket.

ChildBranches.Name: Shore leave
ChildBranches.Description: The parasynthetic jungle holds many dangers. Step carefully. There is no authority beyond the fence.

DefaultEvent.Name: Buried treasure... being buried?
DefaultEvent.Description:
Deep in the forest, an important looking ape in yellow robes oversees two lesser monkeys as they dig a hole in the ground. Having dropped a strange looking idol into the pit and covered it up, one scrapes a deep X over it, while the other slides a map into a bottle, corks it, and scampers off to throw it into the zee.

Curious. However, any treasure hunter who may find the map and follow it here will be out of luck.

ChildBranches.Name: Shore leave
ChildBranches.Description: The parasynthetic jungle holds many dangers. Step carefully. There is no authority beyond the fence.

DefaultEvent.Name: A chance to gather supplies
DefaultEvent.Description: $Port Stanton -> ポート・スタントン$With the help of a few crewmembers, you gather several crates of fruits and berries from the thick jungle. In exchange for a share, the monkeys of Port Stanton are oddly happy to help you sift through and find the best. Much of the crew subsequently suffers from terrible diarrhoea. The two things are, perhaps, unrelated.

ChildBranches.Name: Shore leave
ChildBranches.Description: The parasynthetic jungle holds many dangers. Step carefully. There is no authority beyond the fence.

DefaultEvent.Name: A hunting party!
DefaultEvent.Description: Monkey soldiers scour the jungle for fresh meat. The Empire has little of it, but the unsouled monkeys are considered fair prey by their civilised, ensouled betters. So too are any humans who might disappear without too much trouble. Once back at court, both will be served up and heralded the finest venison, veal, chicken and pork for a Court that knows what it is supposed to like... but not what it actually tastes like. You hide in the bushes until the hunting party has gone, and slip away undetected in the other direction.

ChildBranches.Name: Shore leave
ChildBranches.Description: The parasynthetic jungle holds many dangers. Step carefully. There is no authority beyond the fence.

DefaultEvent.Name: A walk in the woods
DefaultEvent.Description:
An ambush! The twisting paths of the jungle have led far from port, into a dark claustrophobia of trees and mushrooms. The party of savage one-soul apes backs you into a corner, its leader sniffing you with an avaricious hunger. It grins. It lunges.

Hours later, you awaken. Something is... missing.

ChildBranches.Name: Shore leave
ChildBranches.Description: The parasynthetic jungle holds many dangers. Step carefully. There is no authority beyond the fence.

DefaultEvent.Name: Deep in the island
DefaultEvent.Description:
$Pentecost -> ペンテコステ$An ambush! The twisting paths of the jungle have led far from port, into a dark claustrophobia of trees and mushrooms. The party of savage one-soul apes backs you into a corner, its leader sniffing you with an avaricious hunger. Is it the smell that tells it that you have no soul for them today? Or something else?

The ways of the Pentecost apes are mysterious, and this one feels no need to share them. It simply hisses in your face before bidding its minions follow it away.

ChildBranches.Name: Shore leave
ChildBranches.Description: The parasynthetic jungle holds many dangers. Step carefully. There is no authority beyond the fence.

DefaultEvent.Name: An aborted journey
DefaultEvent.Description: The path through the jungle soon becomes dark and treacherous, the predatory eyes of desperate monkeys staring from behind every bush and tree. Exploring this island will have to wait for a more auspicious day.

ChildBranches.Name: Poke around the shore
ChildBranches.Description: The parasynthetic jungle holds many dangers. Step carefully. There is no authority beyond the fence.

DefaultEvent.Name: A most civilised welcome
DefaultEvent.Description: $Delightful Adventuress -> 愉快な女冒険家$"Darling, do come in," the Civilised Mayor purrs. "Whatever can I do for you?" The essence of the Delightful Adventuress sits comfortably in him, a four-souled ape of flexible ethics and cold ambition.

ChildBranches.Name: An Audience with the Civilised Mayor
ChildBranches.Description: Talk business? Why, yes, yes, of course we shall. But after a cup of tea. One must do these things correctly.

DefaultEvent.Name: さようなら@{I}Goodbye
DefaultEvent.Description:
魂を売った後の彼に、それまでと違うところは見受けられなかった。魂の対価として彼は、特徴のない小さな掘っ建て小屋と、安ぴか物のささやかな蓄えを手に入れた。彼はそれらの安ぴか物を、軋みを上げる桟橋から立ち寄る貿易商たちに売ることができるだろう。彼は掘っ建て小屋の扉の前であなたの手を握った。「これまでのご厚意に感謝します、[q:Addressed As]。俺の道具と海図は船室にあります。あれらが、あなたをもっと幸福な船旅に導いてくれることを願っています」

　彼は顔の右半分をのたくる印を手でこすった。何か言おうとしていたことを忘れてしまったらしく、彼はそのまま奥へと去っていった。それきりあなたは、彼の姿を目にすることはなかった。@{I}There is no perceivable difference in him following the sale of his soul. The proceeds furnish him with a tiny, anonymous shack and a modest store of gewgaws to sell to traders who call at the creaking jetty. He shakes your hand at his door. "Thank you for your indulgence, [q:Addressed As]. You will find my equipment and charts in my cabin. I hope they lead you on happier journeys." He rubs at the sigil that now sprawls across the right side of his face, forgets what he was about to say, and goes inside. You do not see him again.

ChildBranches.Name: あなたの航海士が魂を売る手助けをする@{I}Help your navigator sell his soul
ChildBranches.Description: 「もしかしたらここのサルの方が、俺の魂を便利に使うかもしれません」彼はわずかばかりの所持品の袋を肩から提げていた。@{I}"Perhaps one of these apes will make better use of it." He carries his meagre belongings in a pack over his shoulder.

DefaultEvent.Name: Words on the wind
DefaultEvent.Description: $Port Stanton -> ポート・スタントン$The barely-souled monkeys of Port Stanton mutter together in a dozen bastardised dialects: invented stories, gossip twenty years old, intimate revelations from the scraps of subconscious knowledge that adhere to souls. The effect is of sampling a rich, fascinating stew that might just possibly contain rat-droppings. The Admiral would regard this mission as a failure, but others might be interested.

ChildBranches.Name: $Admiralty -> 海軍省, Strategic Information -> 戦略的情報$Gather Strategic Information for the Admiralty
ChildBranches.Description: $Intriguing Snippet -> 興味を引く小話$The Admiral commissioned you to gather information. Here at the Empire's edge, that's difficult, but you could pick up a few scraps. [This will give you an Intriguing Snippet: if you can penetrate the court on Sovereign Island, you may be able to do better.]

ChildBranches.Name: A weak call for help
ChildBranches.Description: An emaciated man is slumped against a wall of the docks, sitting on a huge crate. He waves weakly at you.
